tracks.title: Retrieval & Analytics
tracks.summary: Core querying skills: SELECT, WHERE, joins, aggregates.

quests.title: Q1 – Select from the Stacks
quests.short_description: Learn SELECT, FROM, and basic projections over one table.
quests.long_description: You’re handed a single table in the Archives and asked to answer simple questions. Practice selecting specific columns, aliasing them, and ordering results. No joins yet—just mastering the basics.
objectives: Write SELECT queries that return specific columns.
Use column aliases to improve readability.
Order results with ORDER BY and LIMIT.

quests.title: Q2 – Filters and Ranks
quests.short_description: Filter rows with WHERE and shape result sets.
quests.long_description: The Archives keep growing; you must narrow down results. Apply WHERE filters, combine conditions with AND/OR, and control result size with ordering and limits.
objectives: Use WHERE to filter rows by equality and ranges.
Combine conditions with AND/OR and parentheses.
Apply ORDER BY and LIMIT to answer targeted questions.

quests.title: Q3 – Linking the Wings
quests.short_description: Join multiple tables on keys.
quests.long_description: Data in the Archives is split across wings. Learn to join tables using primary/foreign keys, pick the right join type, and avoid row blow-ups.
objectives: Perform INNER and LEFT joins on key columns.
Explain when to use INNER vs LEFT joins.
Identify and fix duplicate rows caused by bad join conditions.

quests.title: Q4 – Signals from the Stacks
quests.short_description: Aggregate data with GROUP BY and HAVING.
quests.long_description: Curators ask for metrics, not raw rows. Use GROUP BY to aggregate, HAVING to filter groups, and be precise about every non-aggregated column.
objectives: Use SUM, COUNT, AVG, MIN, MAX with GROUP BY.
Filter aggregated results with HAVING.
Explain and avoid ambiguous GROUP BY usage.

quests.title: Q1 – Windows into Time
quests.short_description: Use window functions for rankings and running totals.
quests.long_description: Move beyond aggregates into analytics. Use ROW_NUMBER, RANK, and SUM OVER partitions to compute rankings and rolling metrics without losing row-level detail.
objectives: Use ROW_NUMBER, RANK, and DENSE_RANK for ranking tasks.
Compute running totals with SUM OVER (PARTITION BY ... ORDER BY ...).
Explain differences between GROUP BY and window functions.

quests.title: Q2 – Stories in Layers
quests.short_description: Encapsulate logic in CTEs and views.
quests.long_description: Complex questions deserve layered answers. Learn to break big queries into smaller CTEs and views that are readable, testable, and reusable.
objectives: Refactor long queries using WITH CTEs.
Define and use views for common aggregations.
Compare pros/cons of views vs CTEs in your warehouse.

quests.title: Q3 – Shelving the Archives
quests.short_description: Normalize schemas and add helpful indexes.
quests.long_description: Reshape the Archives so they scale. Learn basic normalization rules, when to denormalize, and how to add indexes that speed up queries without overfitting.
objectives: Identify redundant/duplicated data and propose normalized schemas.
Add indexes to support key query patterns.
Explain tradeoffs between normalization and performance.

quests.title: Q4 – Quieting the Query Storm
quests.short_description: Use EXPLAIN and simple rewrites to tune queries.
quests.long_description: When queries slow the Archives to a crawl, you must tune them. Use EXPLAIN/EXPLAIN ANALYZE and small rewrites (indexes, predicates, projections) to improve performance.
objectives: Read EXPLAIN plans and identify full scans.
Reduce data scanned by adjusting predicates and projections.
Validate improvements via execution times or cost estimates.

bosses.title: Boss: Archive Query Warden
bosses.short_description: Guard of the core query paths in the Archives.

bosses.title: Boss: Archives Reporting Architect
bosses.short_description: Designer of analytic schemas and queries that scale.

quests.title: Q1 – Map of the Machine
quests.short_description: Navigate the file system and processes of a Linux host.
quests.long_description: Learn the basic landmarks on any production host: where logs live, how processes are listed, and how to orient yourself when things go wrong.
objectives: Use ls, cd, find, and permissions commands safely.
List processes and interpret CPU/memory usage.
Locate core logs (syslog, app logs) on disk.

quests.title: Q2 – Who Owns the Port?
quests.short_description: Relate processes to ports and services.
quests.long_description: Production bugs often involve ports. Learn to map open ports to processes, check listeners, and confirm whether services are reachable.
objectives: Use netstat/ss/lsof to list listening ports.
Map ports to owning processes and binaries.
Diagnose a simple 'service not reachable' report.

quests.title: Q3 – Reading the Grid’s Pulse
quests.short_description: Manage services and interpret their logs.
quests.long_description: Services crash, restart, and misbehave. Learn to manage systemd services, read their logs, and spot basic failure patterns.
objectives: Start/stop/restart services using systemd or equivalent.
Tail service logs and correlate them to incidents.
Capture a minimal incident timeline from logs and metrics.

tracks.title: Service Link
tracks.summary: Containerized services behind proxies with health checks and metrics.

quests.title: Q1 – Bottling the Service
quests.short_description: Containerize a service and wire dependencies with Compose.
quests.long_description: Turn your standalone app into a container, define services in docker-compose, and ensure everything starts and stops together.
objectives: Write a Dockerfile for a simple API service.
Define a docker-compose file with service + DB.
Prove the stack is reproducible from a clean checkout.

quests.title: Q2 – Gateway of the Grid
quests.short_description: Front the stack with nginx and TLS.
quests.long_description: Expose your service safely through a reverse proxy. Configure nginx for routing, hostnames, and TLS (self-signed or local CA).
objectives: Configure nginx to route a hostname to your service.
Add TLS (self-signed or dev CA) to the gateway.
Verify the service is reachable via HTTPS.

quests.title: Q3 – Watching for Failure
quests.short_description: Add health checks and auto-restarts.
quests.long_description: Help the Grid heal itself. Add HTTP health endpoints, configure retries and restart policies, and simulate failures.
objectives: Add a /health or /ready endpoint to the service.
Configure health checks at proxy and container level.
Demonstrate a container crash and auto-recovery.

quests.title: Q4 – Telemetry Threads
quests.short_description: Pipe logs and metrics into an observability stack.
quests.long_description: Wire your service’s logs and metrics into a local stack (Prometheus + Grafana / ELK / similar) and build a simple dashboard.
objectives: Expose metrics from the service (e.g., Prometheus format).
Export logs to a centralized destination.
Create a dashboard that shows key service health indicators.

bosses.title: Boss: Gateway Architect
bosses.short_description: Designer of a small but production-like stack.

quests.title: Q1 – Anatomy of a Spell
quests.short_description: Dissect and design clear agent prompts.
quests.long_description: Design system and user prompts that define roles, inputs, outputs, and constraints clearly. Practice writing prompts for a single, bounded task.
objectives: Write a system prompt that defines role and constraints.
Write a user prompt that includes structured inputs.
Identify and remove ambiguous instructions.

quests.title: Q2 – Tools of the Oracle
quests.short_description: Design typed tool contracts.
quests.long_description: Tools are the Oracle’s hands. Define tool schemas with clear types, error states, and security constraints, then wire them into an agent.
objectives: Define a tool with JSON schema or typed interface.
Explain security constraints for a potentially dangerous tool.
Demonstrate a simple tool call flow end-to-end.

quests.title: Q3 – Loop of Thought
quests.short_description: Implement a single-agent loop with memory.
quests.long_description: Build a simple agent loop: receive a task, plan, call tools, and log steps. Add lightweight memory so the agent can use prior steps.
objectives: Implement a single-agent loop in code.
Persist short-term state across tool calls.
Log each step for later debugging.

tracks.title: Grounding
tracks.summary: RAG, multi-agent orchestration, guardrails, and evals.

quests.title: Q1 – Voices from the Library
quests.short_description: Connect an agent to a small RAG pipeline.
quests.long_description: Ground the Oracle in real documents. Ingest a small corpus, implement retrieval, and condition the agent on retrieved context.
objectives: Ingest documents into a simple vector or keyword index.
Implement retrieval for a user query.
Condition agent responses on retrieved context.

quests.title: Q2 – Chambers of Context
quests.short_description: Model environment and long-term state.
quests.long_description: Teach the Oracle about environment and persistent state. Design where long-term state lives and how the agent retrieves and updates it safely.
objectives: Design a data model for long-term agent state.
Implement safe read/write patterns for that state.
Avoid leaking sensitive env or secrets into logs.

quests.title: Q3 – Council of Agents
quests.short_description: Orchestrate multiple agents with clear roles.
quests.long_description: Split responsibilities across multiple agents and design an orchestrator that routes tasks and composes results safely.
objectives: Define at least two specialized agents and their roles.
Implement an orchestrator that routes sub-tasks.
Handle failures and timeouts across agents.

quests.title: Q4 – Boundaries of the Oracle
quests.short_description: Add guardrails and evaluations.
quests.long_description: Wrap your agents in safety: implement policies, logging, and basic evals to catch regressions and risky behaviors.
objectives: Define simple policy checks or allow/deny lists.
Add evaluations for correctness or safety on sample tasks.
Log enough context to debug failures without storing secrets.

bosses.title: Boss: Simulation Weaver
bosses.short_description: Tests single-agent prompt and tool design.

bosses.title: Boss: Orchestrator Conductor
bosses.short_description: Grades your multi-agent, RAG, and guardrail design.

tracks.title: Commit
tracks.summary: Local Git mastery: history, diff, undo.

quests.title: Q1 – First Mark on the Timeline
quests.short_description: Init repos and create meaningful initial commits.
quests.long_description: Create repositories, add files, and craft your first commits with clear messages that tell a story.
objectives: Initialize a Git repo from scratch.
Create commits with descriptive messages.
Inspect commit history with log.

quests.title: Q2 – Reading the Echoes
quests.short_description: Read history and diffs effectively.
quests.long_description: Git history is the story of your changes. Learn to read diffs, follow history, and understand what changed when.
objectives: Use git status, git log, and git diff.
Identify when and where a bug was introduced.
Explain a change using diff output.

quests.title: Q3 – Undoing the Knot
quests.short_description: Recover from common Git mistakes.
quests.long_description: Fearless Git comes from knowing you can recover. Practice undoing local changes, restoring files, and safely reverting commits.
objectives: Use restore/checkout to undo local changes.
Use revert to undo a bad commit without rewriting history.
Explain when (and when not) to use reset.

tracks.title: Branch
tracks.summary: Branching, rebasing, conflicts, and PR flows.

quests.title: Q1 – Forking Futures
quests.short_description: Create and manage feature branches.
quests.long_description: Branch the Timeline. Create feature branches, keep them small, and merge them back cleanly.
objectives: Create and switch between branches.
Keep branches focused with small, cohesive changes.
Merge a feature branch into main.

quests.title: Q2 – The Clean Line
quests.short_description: Use merge and rebase appropriately.
quests.long_description: Practice keeping history clean. Learn when to merge, when to rebase, and how to avoid surprising others.
objectives: Demonstrate a merge workflow with merge commits.
Demonstrate a rebase workflow for local branches.
Explain risks of rebasing shared branches.

quests.title: Q3 – Crossing Timelines
quests.short_description: Resolve merge conflicts confidently.
quests.long_description: Conflicts are inevitable. Learn to resolve them systematically, test after merges, and avoid subtle regressions.
objectives: Trigger and resolve a merge conflict intentionally.
Use tools (IDE, CLI) to resolve conflicts safely.
Verify behavior after conflict resolution.

quests.title: Q4 – Stories for the Team
quests.short_description: Participate in PRs and reviews.
quests.long_description: Work the full collab loop: push branches, open PRs, request review, and respond to feedback with tidy commits.
objectives: Open a PR with a clear description and checklist.
Incorporate review feedback via follow-up commits.
Keep PRs focused and easy to review.

bosses.title: Boss: History Warden
bosses.short_description: Tests your ability to keep and read a clean history.

bosses.title: Boss: Release Conductor
bosses.short_description: Grades your branching, rebasing, and conflict skills.

quests.title: Q1 – Shapes of Thought
quests.short_description: Work with vectors and matrices.
quests.long_description: Get comfortable with NumPy and tensor shapes. Build and reshape arrays, and verify your intuition with simple examples.
objectives: Create 1D, 2D, and 3D arrays.
Reshape arrays and reason about dimensions.
Debug common shape mismatches.

quests.title: Q2 – Signals in Parallel
quests.short_description: Replace loops with vectorized ops.
quests.long_description: Learn why vectorization matters. Rewrite loop-based code into array operations and measure the difference.
objectives: Rewrite loops into NumPy operations.
Explain why vectorization is faster and safer.
Profile a simple before/after example.

quests.title: Q3 – First Synapse
quests.short_description: Implement linear regression by hand.
quests.long_description: Train your first model from scratch. Implement linear regression, compute loss, and fit parameters manually or via gradient descent.
objectives: Implement linear regression prediction and loss.
Fit parameters via closed form or gradient descent.
Visualize data and model predictions.

tracks.title: Tensor & Gradient
tracks.summary: Training loops, metrics, regularization, and serving.

quests.title: Q1 – Step by Step
quests.short_description: Write a training loop with metrics.
quests.long_description: Implement a basic training loop with train/val split, loss, metrics, and logging.
objectives: Split data into train/validation sets.
Track loss and a relevant metric each epoch.
Prevent metric leakage between train and val.

quests.title: Q2 – Overfitting the Synapse
quests.short_description: Recognize and fight overfitting.
quests.long_description: Learn to spot overfitting on plots and metrics and apply simple regularization techniques to fight it.
objectives: Visualize train vs validation curves.
Demonstrate overfitting in a small experiment.
Apply at least one regularization method.

quests.title: Q3 – Choosing the Signal
quests.short_description: Compare models to strong baselines.
quests.long_description: Modeling is only useful relative to baselines. Compare your model to simple baselines and justify when a model is 'good enough'.
objectives: Define and compute a simple baseline.
Compare candidate models to the baseline.
Explain why a more complex model may not be worth it.

quests.title: Q4 – Models in the Wild
quests.short_description: Serve a model and monitor it.
quests.long_description: Ship your model as a simple service, feed it requests, and track basic health and drift indicators.
objectives: Wrap a model in a simple HTTP or batch interface.
Log predictions with minimal, privacy-safe context.
Define a handful of metrics to watch in production.

bosses.title: Boss: Signal Shaper
bosses.short_description: Tests your numerical foundations and simple modeling.

bosses.title: Boss: Gradient Sentinel
bosses.short_description: Grades an ML Training & Evaluation Incident Runbook: splits, diagnostics, experiments, and production thinking.
